TopicTitle: What do you name your space agencies?

Articles.Content: JPL - Jay Planetary Laboratories - Kerbin Institute of technology. Jet proposulsion Laboratorie is my inspiration, and acronym fits my name initials
Tri.optimum

(Just picked up the game and am exploring what to do, so let's make it official... and creative, which will keep me motivated to progress.)

Penguin Enterprises is pleased to announce the purchase of the Kerbal Space Program (game on Steam). The former KSP has been renamed to Kerbal Science Innovators Program, or KerSIP for short. Our motto is "Not Never but NOW" and believe that there's a hole in the sky through which things can fly. Consider us your trusted friend in science.

Upcoming missions and company orders will include, but are not limited to:

the Aeronautical Propulsion Faith Initiative - an experiment to discover if the attributes of efficiency, leadership and orientation will be positively or negatively affected from being catapulted into space.

the Cylindrical Launch Success Encouragement Directive - simply put, "If you make it fly, you won't die."

and finally, the Extraplanetary Terrain Acquiring Commission - instead spending $70 million on them like some crazy guy from Black Aperture or whatever, we will travel to these destinations and gather the material ourselves.

That is all for now. Please look forward to hearing more about the KerSIP as our plans become public.
I named mine the Solaris Initiative, or Sol-In for short. Not sure why, just seemed to sound right.
Taurus Bulldozing and Demolition Inc.

"Kerbal Space Program"

or KSP as it were.

Sometimes I use Jebidiah Kerman Junkyard and Spaceship Parts and Rocketry Launchpad Inc., or JKJSPRL

"North Central Positronics" because when youre a fanboy, you might as well go the extra mile.

Proud partners with the Sombra Corporation

I called mine Darkness, because it sounds a: coolish and b: space-y

C.O.F.F.I.N F.I.L.L.E.R.

I haven't decided what it should stand for. I've been having one of those bad design weeks, and well...

Commercially Orbiting Fully Functional Ion/Nuclear Fighters and Interceptors. LASER and Light Emission Radiation Specialists.

(Technically COFFIN FILLERS, but close enough

Kallon Heavy Industries

Welcome to the future. Nothing's changed.

KAKTUS INC.

Kerbal Aerospace Kinematic Truthseekers & Universal Specialists INitiative Corporation

Commercially Orbiting Fully Functional Ion/Nuclear Fighters and Interceptors. LASER and Light Emission Radiation Specialists.

(Technically COFFIN FILLERS, but close enough

I laughed. hahaha

UshraKhan Space alliance, the company I use for actual pre thought missions (Kethane exploitation, Orbital defence systems, colonial objectives)

Sidewinder technologies, the company I use to figure things out (Heavy Lifter designs, hab module testing, asymetrical vehikle design)

One for the money and one for the show basically

Alacrity Fitz
Arch-angel Industries... somewhat ironic as I hate adding wings
KSP - Kerbal Space Program.

NCSA

Neblian Company Space Agency (formerly NebCo), a branch of the Neblian Company dedicated to space flight, exploration and new technologies that often gets misused by the other agencies of the company...
M.K.A.H.B (Milo Kurtiss Aeronautics and Hot Beverages.)

I keep trying to make some up but they all sound to much like NASA because Aeronautics, Space, and Agency are all words i want to use.

anyway, post yours.

I named mine the CSEH also known as the Canadian Space Ehgency

Hidden bump

Called mine "Kerban Union Frontier Agency", went for that since i spend a lot of time on planes and there have been some boats comming down from that runway.
Denaminatoria Imperis, I don't know why.
"Kerbal Space Program Laboratories and Testing", or "KerSPLaT" for short.
Kerran Empire basicly terran empire (from Star Trek) but kerbalized

Black Cats.

Or KSP, (Kerbin Spectacular Pyrotechnics)

Clarity

"Kerbal Space Program Laboratories and Testing", or "KerSPLaT" for short.

That is genius.

I call my aerospace company Argonaut Aerospace, Inc., they build my space planes and most of the rockets I use. Despite their initials, I suspect their engineers are drunk most of the time. (AA mainly uses B9 parts.)

The space program also contracts with National Orbital Positioning Enterprises, LLC (aka. NOPE) for space station construction and various other jobs. (They're big users of LLL parts and JARFR trusses.)
MArine Command for Astrophysical and Biome Research Expeditions
I go by Big-Ass Conglomerate LLC Not the best name, but I like it.
